title: A Randomized Open-Label, Placebo-Controlled  Study of BRE-701 (selective estrogen receptor modulator) in Patients With Hemophilia A
officialTitle: A Randomized Open-Label, Placebo-Controlled  Study of BRE-701 (selective estrogen receptor modulator) in Patients With Hemophilia A
description: This is a randomized open-label, placebo-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of BRE-701 (selective estrogen receptor modulator) in patients with Hemophilia A. The study will enroll approximately 108 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 25-65 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Hemophilia A
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
